children.name: Contributing
children.example:
## ü§ù Contributing

Contributions are always welcome!

If you have suggestions for improvement, feel free to fork the repo and open a pull request.  
For major changes, please open an issue first to discuss what you‚Äôd like to change.

Check out [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for the full guide.

children.name: Beginner-Friendly Contributions
children.example:
## üå± Beginner-Friendly Contributions

New to open source? No worries! You‚Äôre more than welcome to contribute.

Here‚Äôs how to start:
- Fork this repo
- Clone it locally
- Create a new branch (`git checkout -b feature-name`)
- Make your changes and commit
- Push to your fork and open a Pull Request

Need help? Just drop an issue or contact me!  
See [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) for more info.

children.name: Strict/Professional Contributing
children.example:
## üõ†Ô∏è Contributing

We take code quality seriously, and we appreciate your help in making this project better.

To contribute:
1. Fork the repository
2. Create a new branch from `main`
3. Make sure your code follows our [Code Style Guide](STYLEGUIDE.md)
4. Run tests and ensure everything passes
5. Open a Pull Request with a clear title & description

**Important**: All contributions must follow our [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) and include proper commit messages.

children.name: Internal Collaboration
children.example:
## ü§ù Internal Contributions

If you're part of the team or a collaborator, follow the contribution workflow:

- Create a new feature branch from `dev`
- Use meaningful commit messages (conventional commits preferred)
- Test thoroughly before pushing
- Create a PR and assign reviewers

All contributors are expected to follow the [CONTRIBUTING.md](CONTRIBUTING.md) guidelines.

children.name: Creative/Fun Style
children.example:
## üßÉ Contribute Like a Boss

Found a bug? Got a cool feature idea? Wanna make this project even better?

üí° Ideas ‚Üí Open an Issue

children.name: Basic npm Install
children.example:
Install my-project with npm:
```bash
npm install my-project
```

children.name: Yarn Install
children.example:
If you use Yarn, run:
```bash
yarn add my-project
```

children.name: Global Install
children.example:
Install the CLI globally:
```bash
npm install -g my-project
```

children.name: Clone & Run Locally
children.example:
Clone the repo and start the dev server:
```bash
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/my-project.git
cd my-project
npm install
npm start
```

children.name: Docker Installation
children.example:
Run the project using Docker:
```bash
docker pull yourusername/my-project
docker run -p 3000:3000 yourusername/my-project
```

children.name: Prerequisites
children.example:
Make sure you have these installed before:
- Node.js v16+
- npm v8+
- MongoDB running locally or in the cloud

Check your versions with:
```bash
node -v
npm -v
```

children.name: Windows Specific
children.example:
For Windows users, open PowerShell as administrator and run:
```powershell
npm install -g my-project
```

children.name: Pro Tips
children.example:
- Always use fenced code blocks with language tags for clarity, e.g., `bash`, `powershell`.
- Mention all prerequisites clearly to avoid setup errors.
- Include multiple install options like npm, yarn, global install.
- Keep instructions updated whenever your setup changes ‚Äî stale guides = üòµ‚Äçüí´

children.name: Multiple Endpoints List
children.example:
### API Reference
- `GET /api/items` - List all items
- `GET /api/items/{id}` - Get item by ID
- `POST /api/items` - Create new item
- `PUT /api/items/{id}` - Update item
- `DELETE /api/items/{id}` - Delete item

children.name: GET Endpoint with curl & Response
children.example:
### API Reference

#### Get Items
```bash
curl -X GET https://api.yoursite.com/items
```

Response:
```json
[
  { "id": 1, "name": "Item One", "price": 100 },
  { "id": 2, "name": "Item Two", "price": 200 }
]
```

children.name: POST Endpoint with JSON Body
children.example:
### API Reference

#### Create Item
```bash
curl -X POST https://api.yoursite.com/items \
-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d '{"name": "New Item", "price": 150}'
```

Response:
```json
{
  "id": 3,
  "name": "New Item",
  "price": 150
}
```

children.name: Endpoint with Collapsible Details
children.example:
### API Reference

<details>
  <summary>GET /api/items/{id}</summary>

```http
GET /api/items/{id}
```

- **Path parameter:** `id` - Item's unique identifier

Response:
```json
{
  "id": 1,
  "name": "Item One",
  "price": 100
}
```
</details>

children.name: Endpoint with Schema Definition
children.example:
### API Reference

#### Item Object Schema
```json
{
  "id": "integer",
  "name": "string",
  "price": "number"
}
```

Use this schema for requests and responses involving items.

children.name: Multi-Method Endpoint List
children.example:
### API Reference

| Method | Endpoint          | Description           |
|--------|-------------------|-----------------------|
| GET    | `/api/items`      | List all items        |
| GET    | `/api/items/{id}` | Get item by ID        |
| POST   | `/api/items`      | Create new item       |
| PUT    | `/api/items/{id}` | Update existing item  |
| DELETE | `/api/items/{id}` | Delete item by ID     |

children.name: GitHub Actions + Deploy Script
children.example:
### üì¶ GitHub Actions Deploy
Automatically deploy on push using GitHub Actions.

Workflow:
```yml
name: Deploy
on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - run: npm install && npm run build
      - run: npm run deploy
```

children.name: GitHub Actions Auto-Deploy
children.example:
### ü§ñ GitHub Actions CI/CD

```yaml
name: Deploy
on:
  push:
    branches: [main]
jobs:
  deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v3
      - run: npm install && npm run build && npm run deploy
```

Automatically deploy on every push to `main`.

children.name: Advanced VPS Deploy (with PM2)
children.example:
### üß† VPS Deployment (PM2 + Nginx)

```bash
# SSH
ssh user@your-vps

# Setup
sudo apt update && sudo apt install nodejs npm git -y

# Clone + Deploy
git clone https://github.com/user/project.git
cd project
npm install
npm run build

# Start w/ PM2
npm install -g pm2
pm2 start npm --name "your-app" -- run start
pm2 save
```

children.name: Deployment With .env Setup

### üß™ Deployment (w/ Environment Variables)

Before deploying, create a `.env` file with the following:

```bash
NODE_ENV=production
API_URL=https://api.yoursite.com
JWT_SECRET=supersecretkey
```

Then run:
```bash
npm run build && npm run deploy
```

children.name: Env with Descriptions

### üåç Environment Configuration

Create a `.env` file and define the following:

```env
# Port your app will run on
PORT=3000

# MongoDB connection string
```

children.name: Basic Optimizations List
children.example:
### ‚ö° Optimizations

- ‚úÖ Lazy loading of images and components
- ‚úÖ Memoization with `React.memo`, `useMemo`
- ‚úÖ Code splitting via dynamic imports
- ‚úÖ Debounced input handling
- ‚úÖ Minified assets for production

children.name: Optimization with Tooling Mentions
children.example:
### üîß Optimization Techniques Used

- **Webpack Tree Shaking** to eliminate dead code
- **ESLint + Prettier** for consistent, optimized code
- **React Profiler** used to analyze re-renders
- **Lighthouse Audit** score: 96/100

children.name: Grouped By Category
children.example:
### üß† Optimizations

#### üéØ Performance
- Lazy loading images/components
- Code splitting with `React.lazy`

#### üí° UX Improvements
- Smooth scroll & animations with `framer-motion`
- Preload critical resources

#### üß™ Dev Efficiency
- Auto-imports via `vite-plugin-auto-import`
- ESLint, Prettier & Husky for clean commits

children.name: Collapsible Optimization Details
children.example:
### üß¨ Optimization Details

<details>
<summary>View All Optimizations</summary>

- üöÄ **Lazy Load**: Reduces initial bundle size
- üß† **Memoization**: Avoids unnecessary re-renders
- üì¶ **Tree Shaking**: Eliminates unused exports
- üßµ **Bundle Analyzer**: Used to review build size

</details>

children.name: Table View of Optimizations
children.example:
### üìà Optimization Matrix

| Technique       | Purpose                        | Tool/Method        |
|----------------|---------------------------------|--------------------|
| Lazy Loading    | Speed up initial load          | React.lazy         |
| Memoization     | Prevents re-renders            | useMemo, React.memo|
| Code Splitting  | Smaller JS bundles             | dynamic imports    |
| Minification    | Reduce bundle size             | Terser, Webpack    |

children.name: Basic NPM Test Command
children.example:
### üß™ Running Tests

Run the following command:
```bash
npm run test
```

children.name: Tests with Framework Mention
children.example:
### üß™ Running Tests

This project uses **Jest** for unit tests.
To run tests:
```bash
npm run test
```
Or with watch mode:
```bash
npm run test:watch
```

children.name: Testing With Coverage Report
children.example:
### ‚úÖ Test & Coverage

Run all tests and see coverage:
```bash
npm run test:coverage
```
Generates a report in `/coverage/index.html`

children.name: Tests in Collapsible Format
children.example:
### üß™ Test Instructions

<details>
<summary>How to run tests</summary>

```bash
# Run unit tests
npm run test

# Run E2E tests
npm run test:e2e

# Run with coverage
npm run test:coverage
```

</details>

children.name: Toolchain Based Tests Table
children.example:
### üî¨ Testing Tools

| Type        | Tool    | Command               |
|-------------|---------|------------------------|
| Unit Tests  | Jest    | `npm run test`         |
| Lint Check  | ESLint  | `npm run lint`         |
| Coverage    | Jest    | `npm run test:coverage`|
| E2E         | Playwright | `npm run test:e2e`   |

children.name: Custom Test Scripts
children.example:
### üîß Running Custom Tests

Run specific test suites:
```bash
npm run test:unit       # Unit tests
npm run test:integration # Integration tests
npm run test:e2e        # End-to-End tests
```

children.example:

children.name: Pre-commit Testing Hook
children.example:
### üõ† Pre-Commit Test Hook

This project uses **Husky** to run tests before every commit:
```bash
npx husky install
```

Make sure your `.husky/pre-commit` script includes:
```bash
npm run test
```
